you could send an escape sequence to set the background color to white, followed by an escape sequence to clear the screen, then set the color to black and clear the screen again.
http://www.termsys.demon.co.uk/vtansi.htm
Under the second for Erasing Text, they have the erase screen code to clear the screen with the background color
thanks!
here's a starter: it sets background color to white, clears the screen, waits one second, resets display color and clears the screen
echo -ne '\e[47m\e[2J'; sleep 1; echo -ne '\e[m\e[2J'
\e = <ESC>
